text:
*[Bug 18896] New: readRDS silently returns NULL on malformed RDS*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18896>

            Bug ID: 18896
           Summary: readRDS silently returns NULL on malformed RDS
           Product: R
           Version: R 4.5.x
          Hardware: x86_64/x64/amd64 (64-bit)
                OS: Linux
            Status: UNCONFIRMED
          Severity: normal
          Priority: P5
         Component: Low-level
          Assignee: <mailto:R-core@R-project.org|R-core@R-project.org>
          Reporter: <mailto:aidan.dakhama@kcl.ac.uk|aidan.dakhama@kcl.ac.uk>

it returns `NULL` without any warning or error. However, other corrupted inputs
throw the expected error.

The following is the R script used:
```
cat(">> This fails silently, but should return an error!\n")
file_path <- "params.rds"
file_size <- <http://file.info|file.info>(file_path)$size
cat("File size (bytes):", file_size, "\n")

dump_entire_file <- function(f) {
  b <- readBin(f, "raw", <http://file.info|file.info>(f)$size)
  cat(paste(sprintf("%02X", as.integer(b)), collapse = " "), "\n")
}

# Dump the hex of the file
dump_entire_file(file_path)

# Read it - this is where NULL is returned without an error
parameters <- readRDS(file_path)
print(parameters)

# Now a comparison - corrupted file with forced error
cat("\n\n>> This returns an error! (expected behaviour)\n")
f <- tempfile()
writeBin(as.raw(c(0x1F, 0x8B, rep(0x00, 50))), f)
readRDS(f) 
```

And the following command can be used to create the `params.rds` file:
```
echo -n -e
'\x1F\x8B\x08\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x03\x8B\xE0\x62\x60\x60\x60\x66\x60\x61\x61\x66\x60\x66\x05\x32\x19\xF8\x1C\xFD\xFF\x3D\xE3\x23\x8C\xDA\x4C\x74\x0D\x2D\xCD\x2C\x40\x22\x40\xCC\xEA\x30\xE2\xF9\x01\x17\x55'
> params.rds
```

The following is an example output from this:
```
> Rscript minimal_test.r

>> This fails silently, but should return an error!
File size (bytes): 52 
1F 8B 08 00 00 00 00 00 00 03 8B E0 62 60 60 60 66 60 61 61 66 60 66 05 32 19
F8 1C FD FF 3D E3 23 8C DA 4C 74 0D 2D CD 2C 40 22 40 CC EA 30 E2 F9 01 17 55 
NULL


>> This returns an error! (expected behaviour)
Error in readRDS(f) : error reading from connection
In addition: Warning message:
In readRDS(f) : invalid or incomplete compressed data
Execution halted
```

This was on `4.5.0`:
```
platform       x86_64-pc-linux-gnu         
arch           x86_64                      
os             linux-gnu                   
system         x86_64, linux-gnu           
status                                     
major          4                           
minor          5.0                         
year           2025                        
month          04                          
day            11                          
svn rev        88135                       
language       R                           
version.string R version 4.5.0 (2025-04-11)
nickname       How About a Twenty-Six
```

But was also reproduced in `4.4.2 (2024-10-31)`

It appears to come from `ReadItem_Recursive` in `serialize.c` incorrectly
setting the result to `R_NilValue` without having matched `NILVALUE_SXP`.

--- Comment #2 from Aidan Dakhama (<mailto:aidan.dakhama@kcl.ac.uk|aidan.dakhama@kcl.ac.uk>) ---
For further clarification, this occurs 27 iterations into the
`ReadItem_Recursive` function here:
<https://github.com/wch/r-source/blob/trunk/src/main/serialize.c#L1871>, after
the file is assumed a gz file:
<https://github.com/wch/r-source/blob/trunk/src/library/base/R/serialize.R#L51>.

text:
*[Bug 18885] browser() handles `if (TRUE)` strangely*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18885>

Martin Maechler (<mailto:maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch|maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
     Ever confirmed|0                           |1
             Status|UNCONFIRMED                 |CONFIRMED
                 CC|                            |maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch

--- Comment #3 from Martin Maechler (<mailto:maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch|maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch>) ---
Thank you all, notably Ivan for trying a patch  which makes a lot of sense
I think even leading to nicer code (than considering `R_BrowserLastCommand`) ..
unless we are overlooking something...  (Duncan ?)

Indeed, I've had the nagging feeling that I've encountered the problem myself,
but *not* just with `if(TRUE) ...` but always with `if(.)` - like branches in
the function I've been debugging, and so, such encounters have always reminded
me of
Bug 15770 indeed (thank you, Ivan!).

OTOH, I do notice that ESS (Emacs Speaks Statistics) seems to try to outsmart /
workaround some of the browser() behaviour in this case, and it seems I cannot
even use ESS to reproduce the bug & fix exactly...  but in a regular (Emacs)
shell both bug and bug fix show nicely.

If I only apply your patch, main.c compilation gives (false positive!) warning
```
../../../R/src/main/main.c: In function 'Rf_ReplIteration':
../../../R/src/main/main.c:278:40: warning: 'browsevalue' may be used
uninitialized [-Wmaybe-uninitialized]
  278 |         if (browselevel && browsevalue < 0)
      |                            ~~~~~~~~~~~~^~~
../../../R/src/main/main.c:201:12: note: 'browsevalue' was declared here
  201 |     int c, browsevalue;
      |            ^~~~~~~~~~~
```
which we can easily avoid by setting a dummy at declaration.
Additionally, I'm wrapping the whole `switch(..)`  `case <...>:` with an `{ ..
}`
move the declarations inside that case.
[*NO* need for an updated patch, unless someone sees another problem]
